messages.message: Hey team, I'm trying to make some changes to audit logs in crafting. Is there a way to see the audit logs show up on Crafting or is it only possible to see in SaaS environments?
This is the error i get
Only users with `site_apps:ib_audit_logs` ACL can access this. Try using a site admin account.
@Xindi Xu this is somewhat of a question but for SaaS envs, can anyone be added as a site admin?
No. In deployed environments, try to give the lowest level of permissions. In this case, we should directly assign a user to the audit log app in the Admin app > App permissions page.
If this is just a dev environment, using site admin account is easier
Sounds good, thank you Xindi! I will try it out

So using the site admin account worked. However, it seems all the audit logs are empty with no filters, even though I signed in, created a project, deployment, app and mostly importantly (testing my changes) ran the deployment. I'm wondering if there's any other steps (other than signing in as site admin) to see the logs

Yep, by default, audit logs are not saved locally. I don't know how to do that.

If you just need to see if the logs were created, you can set `"audit_logs_export_endpoint": "RABBIT_MQ"` and check the logs from the search service.
